title: Ericsson's sustainable waste management business venture - Sustainability Magazine
summary: The article discusses Ericsson's recycling initiatives and the digital platform Ericsson Connected Recycling (ECR) aimed at reducing waste in landfills, promoting circularity, and aligning with their net-zero strategy.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article describes Ericsson's efforts in reducing waste and promoting circularity, which align with environmental sustainability goals and contribute to reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article focuses on waste reduction and recycling initiatives by Ericsson rather than introducing new or significantly improved products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE - The article highlights products and processes implemented by Ericsson that significantly reduce environmental impact, promote sustainability, and enhance ecological and human health benefits.
green_process: TRUE - The article discusses Ericsson's green processes in waste reduction and circularity, aiming to minimize environmental impacts, conserve resources, and reduce carbon emissions.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334210 - Telephone Apparatus Manufacturing, 517210 - Wireless Telecommunications Carriers (except Satellite), 541990 - All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities
greenwashing: FALSE - The article highlights concrete actions and initiatives taken by Ericsson to reduce waste and promote sustainability, without presenting misleading information or exaggerated environmental claims.

title: Waste is a design flaw: How ReBorn is turning plastic waste into homewares | Virgin - Virgin
summary: The article discusses the green innovation of ReBorn, a start-up transforming the homeware industry by upcycling industrial waste into design-led products through circular design and sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE, ReBorn's innovative approach of upcycling industrial waste into functional and design-led products qualifies as green innovation due to its focus on circular design and sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE, ReBorn's introduction of new products through upcycling industrial waste represents a significant change from traditional homeware production processes, making it a form of business innovation.
green_product: TRUE, ReBorn's focus on using industrial waste for its products, upcycling materials, and promoting circular design principles qualifies its offerings as green products.
green_process: TRUE, ReBorn's utilization of sustainable waste management practices, upcycling industrial waste, and collaborating with eco-friendly partners showcases the adoption of green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 326199 (All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing), 322299 (All Other Converted Paper Product Manufacturing), 337124 (Metal Household Furniture Manufacturing), 444220 (Nursery, Garden Center, and Farm Supply Stores)
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it genuinely focuses on ReBorn's sustainable and circular design practices, avoiding any false or misleading environmental claims.
